bibl.title: Local Epigraphic Habit and the Genesis of Monumental Inscriptions in Ptolemaic Egypt.
bibl.note: Presents three 'monumental' inscriptions: I. Hermoupolis 1; - O.G.I.S. I, 94 [= I. Akoris 1]; - S.E.G. XXXVII 1622 [= I. Akoris 3, reign of Domitian], rediscovered in 2003 during Japanese investigations at the quarry in the rocky desert to the northeast of the site.

bibl.title: with the Collaboration of Yoshiyuki SUTO, Genesis of Historical Text. Text / Context

bibl.seg: SUTO Yoshiyuki, Local Epigraphic Habit and the Genesis of Monumental Inscriptions in Ptolemaic Egypt.

Shoichi SATO (Ed.), with the Collaboration of Yoshiyuki SUTO, Genesis of Historical Text. Text / Context = 21st Century COE Program. International Conference Series No. 4. Proceedings of the Fourth International Conference, Studies for the Integrated Text Science [Nagoya, 16-17 September 2004] (Nagoya, 2005) pp. 13-20; - 20-22 (Discussion).

Presents three 'monumental' inscriptions: I. Hermoupolis 1; - O.G.I.S. I, 94 [= I. Akoris 1]; - S.E.G. XXXVII 1622 [= I. Akoris 3, reign of Domitian], rediscovered in 2003 during Japanese investigations at the quarry in the rocky desert to the northeast of the site.
